description:
Symbol for a sale, or bargain prices in Japan (“cut prices”). Literally translated, this character means to cut or divide.

CJK Ideographs are characters used in Chinese, Japanese and Korean languages. Their writing systems all completely or partly use Chinese characters.
apple_vendor_description: Apple's rendition of the Japanese discount button emoji is a striking circular emblem featuring bold, stylized Japanese characters against a bright yellow background, all with a glossy, slightly raised appearance.  The clean lines and vibrant color palette, enhanced by Apple's signature 3D shading, make it stand out clearly on any device.  This emoji effectively signifies savings, deals, or special offers, particularly in contexts related to Japanese culture or shopping, as rendered with Apple's precise design aesthetic.
